metadata.title: Pakistan urgently needs to accelerate progress on sustainable development goals, says Climate Minister

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, May 06 (APP):Pakistan must urgently realign its development priorities with the global 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, Federal Minister for Climate Change Dr. Musadik Malik said on Tuesday. Speaking at the Pakistan SDGas Policy Dialogue for Action in Islamabad, he warned that the country ranks lowest in South Asia on SDG progress. Pakistan currently sits at 137 out of 166 countries in the 2024 SDG Index, scoring just 57.02, far behind neighbors like India (63.99), Bangladesh (64.35), and Sri Lanka (67.43). Dr. Malik highlighted severe challenges in clean water, sustainable cities, climate action, and governance, stressing that SDGs have not been properly integrated into provincial plans. aWe are on the brink of water scarcity, yet lack the seriousness this issue demands,a he said, calling the crisis a asilent national emergency.a He also criticized worsening urban pollution, stating, aOur cities are among the most polluted in the world a this is not progress, but environmental collapse.a The minister urged collaboration between government, civil society, and businesses, emphasizing evidence-based policies and climate finance. aDevelopment is not just about numbers a it is about clean air, safe drinking water, dignified living, and a secure future,a he said. The ministry pledged to work with provinces and stakeholders to accelerate SDG progress. Dr. Malikas closing warning: aTime is running out. Eitherwe, act now, or history will leave us behind.a
